title: (x) Rock gig poster woodtype - various {gang}
content:
This style is seen on rock gig posters a lot.. is this a font or is it just a mash?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130628041037im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font1_3910.jpeg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130628041037im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font2_5713.jpeg)
author: wizard7926

comments.content:
They look like the work of Jim Sherraden at Hatch Show Print.

Wood type.

But check out Champion Gothic from H&FJ

[http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100002](http://web.archive.org/web/20130628041037/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100002 "http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100002")

You're dead on. Love his stuff. Wood type makes a lot of sense.. is there anything similar font available?

I'm thinking of making a fake gigposter-inspired tshirt design for a band that I design for, so I'm hoping to start with a base font and mix it up from there.

Champion Gothic looks REALLY close, at least close enough. Thanks guys! :)

It's been a while, anybody remember me?

I've used [this artwork](http://web.archive.org/web/20130628041037/http:/www.withoutwalls.com/) for a few concert posters I've done.

Also, check out the Device Type Collection.

Michael
You beat me to it. I was about to say Hatch Show. These appear to be letterpress, mixed wood block type.

also in this category might be:

Local Gothic from Christian Schwartz  
 [http://www.vllg.com/Schwartzco/LocalGothic/mudTyper+Weights/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130628041037/http:/www.vllg.com/Schwartzco/LocalGothic/mudTyper+Weights/ "http://www.vllg.com/Schwartzco/LocalGothic/mudTyper+Weights/")

and

the BLINKtype letterpress fontpak from Chank  
 [http://www.chank.com/font\_detail.php?sku=5483](http://web.archive.org/web/20130628041037/http:/www.chank.com/font_detail.php?sku=5483 "http://www.chank.com/font\_detail.php?sku=5483")

Hatch does some really nice stuff. I live in Nashville and wish I had gotten an internship there. Unfortunately, Jim Sherraden had already hired his summer interns. Really nice guy. It's all 100-year old wood type on letterpress. Fantastic stuff in an age where design sometimes gets too "clean." Hooray for getting ink on your hands. :)

A few more fonts that could work

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ephemera/toronto-gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130628041037/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ephemera/toronto-gothic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ephemera/toronto-gothic/")

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/thometz/silvertone-woodtype/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130628041037/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/thometz/silvertone-woodtype/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/thometz/silvertone-woodtype/")

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/garage-gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130628041037/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/garage-gothic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/garage-gothic/")

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/device/wormwood-gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130628041037/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/device/wormwood-gothic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/device/wormwood-gothic/")

Here's the Hatch Show Print web site

[http://countrymusichalloffame.com/site/experience-hatch.aspx](http://web.archive.org/web/20130628041037/http:/countrymusichalloffame.com/site/experience-hatch.aspx "http://countrymusichalloffame.com/site/experience-hatch.aspx")

Did anyone already mention this:

[http://withoutwalls.com/index.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20130628041037/http:/withoutwalls.com/index.htm "http://withoutwalls.com/index.htm")

??

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO

The fact it's a poster for the Ryman pretty much gives it away as a Hatch piece.

When I was at Blinc, we did some fonts based off of wood type for Chank (which I now see has already been mentioned). There's also usually an ad in most of the design rags for someone selling a wood type CD that is scans of wood type alphabets.

And, yes, if you're ever in Nashville, definitely hit Hatch. Jim is, indeed, a very nice guy.

This guy, Casey, works with Jim on some of the Hatch posters. He has a nice garage shop and a good selection of wood type, FWIW.

[http://www.inkylipspress.com/posters.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130628041037/http:/www.inkylipspress.com/posters.html "http://www.inkylipspress.com/posters.html")
